name: Linked to the past
description: A deck around links and restore. Wyrm is here for atman. HQ and RD interface to change your mind during the game. With Compromises employee and links, you are no more preoccupied by trace, you can run easly on caduceus and other nbn trace cards.

name: Kate contacts vHJ2.5
description: -3 rabbit holes for +3 borrowed satellite. Added one net shield for Jinteki hate. Borrowed satellite is also anti Jinteki and helps Scorched earth.

name: Bob's bringing out Wotan NEXT
description: A deck all about the big ice coming out cheap and easy.

name: Replicating the Dew (feedback)
description: Sundew, server diag encryption and get lots of money

name: Hyperzontal v0.2
description:
Alix T4LBO7 + Shipment from Mirrormorph makes a pot of money, and accelerates the horizontal nature of the deck, setting up Shell Games even faster. Shipment from Kaguya continues the shell game theme by spreading advancement tokens across multiple potential Agenda &/or advanceable Ambushes, presenting the Runner with difficult choices. Trick of Light means 'wasted' Ambush advancement actions can be recovered. Celebrity Gift and Hedge Fund could go up, but with Alix, PAD, Private Contracts (Siphon sink!) and Server Diagnostics money often isn't an issue. Don't bank on your Ice to stop the Runner though.

For a more detailed discussion of the Hyperzontal combo and deck performance, see my blog post here: http://daman-asha.livejournal.com/29747.html

name: Dumpster Diving v1.3
description:
Core combination: trigger Joshua B., Vamp the Corp to broke as your first action, taking the tag from Vamp. Use the next three/four actions to mill cards with the Data Leak Reversal. A broke Corp may gain 2 credits and trash the DLR, going broke again, but then repeat the process by running Archives, play a DLR and mill more. If you sniff a Scorched Earth, play at least one of the Plascretes to defend against post-Vamp Beanstalk/Scorch. Cyberfeeder and Darwin are BFF; and Spinal is a great console with Darwin, ably supported by e3 Feedback Chip, too.

For a more detailed discussion of the deck see my blog post: http://daman-asha.livejournal.com/29747.html

name: Systematic Gambling
description: A deck that aims to punish the runner for hitting centrals and force him to have to sweat for literally every single AP. Not much ICE, but worthy ICE, and painful: Archer is a light weight on your conscience when you just have to throw away a single point to punish the runner hardly, and Uroboros is a priority target that drains your basterd's economy while Caduceus bolsters yours. Fetal AI can be good in these situations, when they can't pay for the score and you can rez for the damage. Swordsman is a must that damages and limits the runner's freedom and gives you room and time to score your small agendas while the poor guy rebuilds his Atman/Darwin/Crypsis, or even Knight, somehow. In this bloody mess, small agendas mingled with Snares and Junebugs maximize your scoring capabilities, making every target a vital target and forcing the guy to choose the lesser evil among your armored centrals.

name: Killer Combo
description: Deck takes advantage of Power Shutdown milling entire deck, then using Jackson Howard to put back in either a) SEA Source, and Scorched Earth x2, or b)Midseason Replacements and 2x Psycographics. Accelerated Diagnostics then either bags the runner or advances a Project Beale for the win.
